channel.title: Rebuilding pc
channel.description:
Well I've just found out that my pc needs a few new upgrades considering the information that I gathered from my last thread.
Here are my pc specs
Processor AMD Athlon 64 X2 3 GHz Chipset What is "Chipset"? NVIDIA GeForce 6150 SE Installed Memory 3 GB (DDR2 SDRAM) Operating System What is "Operating System"? Microsoft Windows Vista Home Premium Processor Processor Type AMD Athlon 64 X2 Processor Speed 3 GHz Processor Manufacturer AMD Motherboard Video Output Interface PCI Express [Slot x2] Memory RAM Technology DDR2 SDRAM Installed RAM 3 GB - DDR2 Installed Cache Memory 2 MB Technical Features Expansion Slots PCI Express x16 x 1 • PCI x 1 • PCI Express x1 x 2 Hard Drive Hard Drive Capacity 320 GB
Now I mainly want to upgrade my graphics card so I'm debating between these two - [url=http://www.bestbuy.com/site/olspage.jsp?skuId=8968138&st=nVidia+geforce+9800&lp=2&type=product&cp=1&id=1217029964973]9800[/url] or [url=http://www.bestbuy.com/site/olspage.jsp?skuId=8657562&st=8800+GT&lp=1&type=product&cp=1&id=1196469743575]8800[/url] If you can help me choose between those two [if you read my specs I have pcie x16] Also this was what I was thinking for my pcu
http://www.bestbuy.com/site/olspage.jsp?skuId=8774267&st=PSU&lp=2&type=product&cp=1&id=1204331807576 650 Watts My current psu is only 300watts If you guys can help me with what to purchase/better deals it'd be great. I don't really know what pcu to get but it has
-650-watt power supply; ATX 12V version 2.2 -6 SATA connectors for Serial ATA hard drives -Low-noise 120mm fan runs cool and quiet -Universal input; three 12V inputs and 1 PCI-E connector
So it seems decent. I heard that the best wattage for the 9800 is 600+ and minimum is 500 so this seems to be what I need but I'm not sure if it's compatible with my pc [Gateway GT5668E Desktop Computer]
For the rest I think my ram and processor are fine. So thanks in advance
[I'm really not trying to go past $250.00 so within that price range it'd be great]

item.title: Rebuilding pc
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:29, topic:295870”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=391895.msg2924615#msg2924615 date=1250941753]
There’s a huge difference between High and Very High, especially on the textures. Also, the performance difference between High and Very High is insane.
[/quote]

Hmm still I never seem to notice only performance wise.[/quote]
Anyways it wouldn’t matter to me I don’t like crysis

Read full topic

item.title: Rebuilding pc
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:26, topic:295870”][quote author=chrisn2323 link=topic=391895.msg2922899#msg2922899 date=1250861949]

My brand new 4850 plays crysis in high settings nice and smooth (can’t unlock very high for some reason. And I have no sound on my pc now :’(. )

don’t you need vista and Dx10 for very high?
[/quote]

There is a way to unlock very high settings in vista using a custom .ini file for it, google something along the lines of “crysis very high xp”.[/quote]

Yeah Ive done this before pretty simple but I really didnt see any difference but then again I dont see much difference between medium and high.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

mwiebelhaus:

Nice choices though I’ll always be happy with my 8800gt I can play crysis on medium for first one or mainstream on warhead at 1680x1050 and thats all I need plus its really cheap now. Though id never buy it for a new build anymore.

Thanks the packages just got in my state yesterday [11:30pm] with ups 3day select so I’m expecting it to arrive tomorrow or Saturday [expected delivery is Monday the 24th but hopefully it’ll come earlier]. Anyways I heard that the 9800gt can run crysis on high or maybe I heard wrong…

But I’m sure if you oc you can

item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:12, topic:295870”]don’t worry, all you need is that 9800gtx+ (which is better than the 9800gt) 1gb vram on it means nothing unless your using a 24"+ monitor in highest resolutions.

all you need is a motherboard that has PCI-e 8x or 16x slot.[/quote]
Thanks but I ordered a 9800gt 512mb =
Oh well I think it’ll still do me well :).

item.title: Rebuilding pc

item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

don’t worry, all you need is that 9800gtx+ (which is better than the 9800gt) 1gb vram on it means nothing unless your using a 24"+ monitor in highest resolutions.

all you need is a motherboard that has PCI-e 8x or 16x slot.

item.title: Rebuilding pc
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

xEnt:

Alright listen, that 9800GTX+ blows the 8800gts out of the water, and is cheaper. Since Antec earthwatts is a very good PSU, get a 550w it will handle it fine. But since that 650w is on special, and cheaper than the 500. stick to what i’ve said.

Yeah I will get the 9800+ the 650w psu

Just worried on installing them :s

Btw whats the average shipping time on newegg?

Edit: Found a better psu on newegg 700w for $49.99 - is it good? http://www.newegg.com/Special/ShellShocker.aspx

Also was thinking about this card - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814130440

But what are the cables that come for it? Power connectors w/e. I have no idea of how to use them…:s

Also does the type of memory the card has have to do with any ram? Or other components like that

Read full topic

item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

mwiebelhaus:

Yeah they will probably install it upside down or something (fan facing up if psu goes on top for geek squad) they are that stupid.

Anyways, now I’m going to look for a video tutorial. I’ll also take my case off and take a look at the graphics card and psu and just try to get my visuals on the inside. Then if it still turns out I can’t install them, I’ll take it to this small computer business owned by two brothers and it costs like $20.

Edit: I’m just wondering how would I know if it’d work with my pc?
